full_text: Ble el Tp on pois 2016/KER/33655 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAT. PASHA MONDAY, THE 1ST DAY OF AUGUST 2016/10TH SRAVANA, 1938 Cr1.MC.No. 628 of 2015 cc 707/2011 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, KARUNAGAPPALLY PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED: JIBIN SHAH, AGED 22 YEARS, S/O.JALEEL, RESIDING AT JIBIN VILLA, MOZHUNGODI MURI, THODIYOOR VILLAGE. BY ADV.SRI.M.T.SURESHKUMAR RESPONDENT (S) /STATE: STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM, PIN-682031. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT.HYMA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 01-08-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: PJ Ble el Tis crear leer 2016/KER/33655 Cr1.MC.No. 628 of 2015 APPENDIX PETITIONERS' ANNEXURES ANNEXURE 1: COPY OF THE FIR DATED 4/10/2010 IN CRIME NO.2066/2010 OF THE KARUNAGAPPALLY POLICE STATION ANNEXURE 2: COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT DATED 31/5/11 IN CRIME NO.2066/10 OF THE KARUNAGAPPALLY POLICE STATION. RESPONDENTS' ANNEXURE NIL. / TRUE COPY / P.S. TO JUDGE PI eee 2016/KER/33655 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. ee ee ee ORDER Petitioner is the sole accused in C.C.No.707 of 2011 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Karunagappally, for the offences punishable under Sections 468 and 471 of the Indian Penal Code and Section 12(b) of the Passports Act, 1967. 2. The petitioner has sought for getting the prosecution proceedings against the petitioner quashed on two grounds. The first ground is that sanction of the Central Government, as contemplated under Section 15 of the Passports Act, has not been obtained and therefore, the prosecution proceedings shall not lie as far as the offence under the Passports Act is concerned. 3. AS per Section 15 of the Passports Act, no prosecution shall be instituted against any person in respect eee 2016/KER/33655 CRL.M.C.No. 628 of 2015 uoe of any offences under the Act, without the previous sanction of the Central Government. When it has come out that no sanction was obtained, the offence under the Passports Act will not lie and therefore, the same is liable to be quashed. 4. With regard to the offences under the IPC, the learned counsel for the petitioner has pointed out that at the time of the alleged commission of the offence, the petitioner was a juvenile. Hence, the petitioner can only be considered as a juvenile in conflict with law. Therefore, the matter has to be reported before the Juvenile Justice Board. The prosecution proceedings based on Annexure 2 final report in C.C.No.707/2011 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Karunagappally, as far as the petitioner is concerned, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and the prosecution proceedings based on Annexure 2 final report in C.C.No.707/2011 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Karunagappally, as far as the petitioner is concerned, Pre ao) apo 2016/KER/33655 CRL.M.C.No. 628 of 2015 3: are hereby quashed. It is made clear that this Order will not stand in the way of the investigating officer to report the matter before the Juvenile Justice Board. Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE. ul/- // true copy // PS. to Judge.
